entry.title: Keep the Matches away from the Sunflower
entry.summary:
Author: DiamondBat

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,144Chapters: 12/16Kudos: 338

Summary: Batman and Superman have a love/hate relationship going on due to some misunderstandings and unexpressed emotions. With no other way of dealing with the unresolved tension, both of them end up on the same dating app. From there, a romance blossoms that neither of them expected or have any way of escaping. (I originally started this with Batfleck x Cavill Superman in mind and still picture this pairing strongly. However, after watching the new Superman movie, I am now conflicted and can see this working with Corensupes and whatever Batman the reader wants to pair him with. So long as that Batman is older and beefier than Corensupes.)

entry.title: Zhia'rev
entry.summary:
Author: Holdt

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,412Chapters: 5/5Kudos: 2

Summary: Clark has always described their sex as "good." He's made peace with it, convinced his alien body isn't built for human-type pleasure. Bruce refuses to accept that. Fortress databases reveal the truth: Kryptonian males need specific cervical stimulation to achieve complete sexual response. Without it, they experience only thirty percent capacity. Clark has spent years settling for a fraction of what his body can feel. So Bruce builds a solution. Now Clark discovers what his body was designed for. Good was never good enough.

entry.title: Two's Company, Three is a Crowd, Four is a Party
entry.summary:
Author: Heylittleguy21

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,593Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 101

Summary: Every machine is made up of smaller, more intricate parts that help the machine function. A cog turns another cog that cog turns another cog which turns another cog. These cogs eventually turn the hands on a clock tower. Even the smallest one is fundamental to the efficiency of the clock tower. For the Justice League, you are that cog. You keep them turning. You keep the public's infallible heroes functioning, you keep them from falling apart. The public may never know your face or your name and they definitely won't know that you're the glue that keeps the Justice League together. The public will never know how essential you are to the Justice League and even more to the "Trinity". Or how you will be. This fic describes how exactly you become a vital part of the Justice League and maybe fall in love along the way.

entry.title: Nobody Told Me University Would Be Like This
entry.summary:
Author: BobBalaban

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,180Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 18

Summary: College certainly wasn’t Bruce Wayne’s idea. If he had his way, he would immediately have started working for his father once he graduated high school. It’s not that he doesn’t love learning, because of course he does, but what he doesn’t love is people. College is a way too social experience for him to be comfortable. But his father and Alfred insisted. Because college is a “great way to find yourself and your people.” He hasn’t done either of those things and it’s already been a year. Sometimes he feels like there is nothing to find within himself. Whatever was there died the night his mother did. OR: an AU in which Bruce attends Gotham University at the request of his father and makes some unexpected friends along the way.

entry.title: A Kryptonian and His Gladiator
entry.summary:
Author: Eyeslikedawn

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,238Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 68

Summary: Kryptonian society on the conquered planet Earth is complicated to say the least. When Lord Kal-El's house-guard is slain he decides to rebuild his ranks by purchasing a prized gladiator from Gotham City. His name is Bruce Wayne but the fans of the arena know him as Batman. Regardless of what they call him, though, with the human's stoic demeanor, and grim attitude, Kal has certainly bought more than he bargained for.

entry.title: Courting
entry.summary:
Author: Gh0stsh4rk

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,355Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 74

Summary: Bruce looks at Clark for the first time since he began driving, just for a second before looking back to the road. He pulls into the first empty stretch of road that he spots before turning to Clark again, "You thought I offered to bring you to my favorite restaurant in Gotham for an interview?" He tries to suppress the smirk that pulls at the corners of his mouth. "…yes..?" he says, the bravado of Clark Kent Reporter quickly fading as uncertainty creeps into his voice. "I was actually hoping this might be a date, Clark."
